intro: Oenanthe caucasica, commonly known as Caucasian water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Oenanthe caucasica is often found in temperate climates and is adapted to cool, humid conditions.
